newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Feb 28.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Feb 28.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
- Li Ruihuan opens opening session of Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference
- China's colleges and universities plan to enrol 1.01 million students this year
- Commentary on 25th anniversary of signing of Shanghai Communique
- Commentary on anniversary of "February 28" incident in Taiwan
- Industrial and Commercial Bank of China boosts supervision on loan collection and bans new loans to firms unable to repay oustanding debt
- PICC (Property) promises $204 million insurance cover for BP China acetic acid venture
- Central Bank approves Harbin urban cooperative bank, Zhenjiang urban cooperative bank to open
- China industrial output seen up 10 percent to 126 billion yuan in February
- Survey of 30,000 urban residents shows top concern is social stability
- China Construction Bank foreign exchange settlement hit $34.8 billion in 1996
